arm_group.description: T-cell immunoglobulin- and mucin-domain-containing molecule 3 (TIM-3) is a novel transmembrane protein that is involved in the regulation of Th1-cell-mediated immunity.

brief_summary.textblock:
This study investigated the expression of T-cell immunoglobulin- and mucin-domain-containing
      molecule 3 (TIM-3) in the colonic mucosa and/or the peripheral blood of children with
      Crohn's disease during anti TNF-α (infliximab) therapy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Expression of TIM-3 and Correlation With Disease Activity in Pediatric Crohn's Disease With Anti TNF-α Therapy

detailed_description.textblock:
The immunoregulatory effects of TIM-3 on patients with Crohn's disease according to the
      treatment have not yet been investigated.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  •Pediatric patients who were diagnosed with severe Crohn's disease who require
             infliximab treatment

               -  confirmed diagnostic of Crohn's disease in clinical, endoscopic and histological
                  findings

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  •patients who has proven to have infliximab antibody

clinical_study.official_title: Expression of T-cell Immunoglobulin- and Mucin-domain-containing Molecule 3 (TIM-3)and Correlation With Disease Activity in Pediatric Crohn's Disease With Anti TNF-α Therapy

primary_outcome.description: Disease Activity Index (PCDAI) scores, Peripheral blood for TIM-3 mRNA expression
primary_outcome.measure: Expression of TIM-3 and Correlation With Disease Activity in Pediatric Crohn's Disease with anti TNF-α Therapy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
